marklogic.body: Ah, so anyone who questions you (a medical student who can read) is a nut? Wow. Not only do I read peer reviewed articles, I actually do theÂ research, write the articles, and have them published ... you then read what I wrote. Please try and learn how to be objective and consider all facets of an argument. Vaccines are not safe. There have been may instances world-wide that were deadly. For a great read, use Google Scholar and look up the Swine Flu Vaccine debacle from the mid 1970's. Truly listening, having an open mind, and formulating informed opinions of your own, even if they go against the status-quo, is what will set you apart and Gain you enormous respect from your patients and your peers.
